storyInfo: Faced with the prospect of hundreds of thousands of Durin who might rely on Acahualla to survive, Gavial feels a pressure and responsibility she never has before, while Avdotya goes to the library to search for a map to the surface.

attributes.content: Head for the surface?
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: The Durins have never been to the surface before!
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Uh, didn't Stitch? And the people who brought all those library books back from overground?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: And look, nothing in the rulebook says you can't, right?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: I mean, listen to you guys. The tunnel's too dangerous, a new shelter's gonna take too long.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: So, you head up top and take refuge in Acahualla for a while. That's the best plan to me.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: That lift could hardly hold so many...
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: I really want to refute you, but...
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Your group missed it during your time in Zeruertza, but trains are by far the most common means of transport in Durin society.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Though lifts are convenient for vertical movement...
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Durin cities aren't nomadic, so they face the risk of destruction from the moment they're built. Lifts that can only move vertically have far less use to them than trains do.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Moreover, Durin explorers have calculated that Durin cities often lie 1000 to 1500m below the surface. Hardly any cities exist outside of that range.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Which is to say, Durins probe the underground in horizontals. It's rare for there to be one city just a hundred, maybe two hundred meters below another.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Uh... so what does this have to do with the lift?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: I know explaining this to you is a waste of time, but I have to show responsibility for others here.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: What? All you're trying to tell me is trains are more Durin-handy, yeah?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: *sigh* I suppose so.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: And given that, what purpose would a lift then have for existing?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: I get it. It's for resources, isn't it?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: I don't claim to know why the Durins tend to expand their cities horizontally. Some kind of ingrained habit, I guess.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: But forget that. It doesn't mean they scout out resources horizontally as well. Right?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: I thought you were playing the braggart when you claimed you'd been places. I can definitely see your prowess now.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Wowie.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Gavial, check it. Even Miss Avdotya here sees my worth better than you do.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Big whoop. Don't care.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Miss Avdotya, next time you get into an argument with Gavial, I'm on your side.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: I'll be fine, thank you.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Anyhow, you're correct. The Durins are filled with a passion for probing underground, especially for minerals.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: In addition, city planning requires the joint decisions of many, while digging is something each Durin is free to commit to at their leisure.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Consequently, they often end up digging several hundred meters above or below their cities out of sheer unawareness.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: In fact, quite a number of Durin historians believe...
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: The first Durin lift was only designed when an industrial representative discovered a vein in the roof of their very own city, and that it would be most convenient to dig straight to it.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: However, following an unchecked surge of Durin interest in the surface, such lifts have often been used as shortcuts to the overground.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Huh... so you're saying Durins mainly use it to shift ore, and sometimes there's little scamps like Stitch hitching a ride on them to have some surface fun.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: I've told you, I'm about the same age as you, Gavial!
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: Uh-huh, sure. So, I mean, I get all that, but I still don't understand what you're getting AT.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Miss Avdotya's trying to say that since Durin lifts are mostly designed for industry, they're real sturdy stuff.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Tomimi and me sure noticed that when we came down. The lift could hold a few dozen people, no sweat.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: So, Gavial, your suggestion's pretty feasible.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Right, Master Edge?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Hear, hear.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: I can confirm, the Super Convenient Lift-o-Matic #1 was designed after a vote, which came after some numbskull with nothing to do found a vein up above.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: But then we found a vein even closer, so the thing went by the wayside.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Oh, that tracks. I heard that one cave got mined clean. You think it was you Durin guys who dug the entire cave out in the first place?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: That, I couldn't say. It's possible.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: In addition, to cope with potential future situations, the Durins would have naturally dug out more space while planning the lift, for ease of future enlargement.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Which means, if we're going to make the most reasonable use of our remaining time, enlarging the lifts and getting the Durins to the surface is definitely the way to go.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Oh. You could've just said that then.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: If you only know what to do, and not why you're doing it, then you'll run into setbacks someday.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Yeah, I know that.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: But I'm a doctor, Avdotya.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: And look, you know it deep down, don't you?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: How could I ever not trust you?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Why didn't anyone tell me we were getting along so well?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: In my opinion, we're already best buds.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Long and short of it is, I approve of Gavial's suggestion.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: You can hammer out the remaining details. I'll be continuing the survey.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: I'll help you out, Master Edge. My Arts can transmit info. If you turn up any results, I can notify everyone first thing.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Aye.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Oh, yeah, I forgot.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Miss Avdotya, I understand. You're against returning to the surface, and your own experiences inform that.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: But you're one of Zeruertza's driving citizens, too. Your opinion swings things.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: And you're an honorable person, on top of that. Now's not the time for it, and you get that, don't you?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: ...*sigh*.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Alright, everyone. Rustle us up a happy plan.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: I'll help Master Edge too. No point in tossing around landmark designs now.
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: Huh? Not like there's anything you can do in there, right?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Can I not be concerned for my own city?
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: Oh. Sure. Knock yourself out.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: So, Avdotya, you still against it?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: (Deep breath in and out)
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: If this is the best method we have to save the people of Zeruertza, then my small contrarianism hardly amounts to anything.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: However. Gavial.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: You're very strong. Stronger, even, than most Ursus soldiers I've met.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: But this isn't a problem you can solve with just strength.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Have you thought about how we're dealing with hundreds of thousands of Durins here?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: If hundreds of thousands of people showed up out of nowhere in a region of Sargon, do you know how terrifying that would be?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: This isn't something you can solve just by telling us your rainforest is big enough.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: How will the region's lord ameer react?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: And how will Sargon as a nation react?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: They're going to the surface because they believe in you, but if the reality awaiting them is crueler still...
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Do you still have the courage to say that no other way will work?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Gavial, you would be the most fitting lord ameer for Acahualla. You are the only one who can rein in each and every Tiacauh.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Everyone is awaiting your return.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: And if you simply cannot do it, then it's ultimately likely... that a lord ameer from the Court of Sargon will come to govern Acahualla instead.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: And when that happens, Acahualla will no longer be the free land you knew.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Gavial swallows a sliver of hesitation.
She realizes the choice is now facing her, waiting, and she didn't even notice that it came.
No, she's not unwilling to assume this duty. Far from it.
Not even on her vagrant trails, not even in her days on end at Rhodes Island, did she ever forget Acahualla and her people.
However
Neither has she forgotten the decision she made, when she resolved to leave Acahualla in the first place.
She was going to study medicine. She was going to save the Oripathy sufferers.
Those two choices she made were the right ones, and they were what she wanted. That's how simple it was. That's why she's never found it this hard to choose.
So it seems it's crossed your mind. You're not that much a simpleton.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: So, Gavial. If you truly can settle this problem, then I would be willing to even persuade the Durins for you.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: What is your answer?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: But. Just as Avdotya says, if this is the only way to save Zeruertza...
If her becoming the lord ameer would solve this problem...
If this is the price she must pay to abide by her own ideals
Then in that case
I
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: II'll be Acahualla's lord ameer, and I'll bear the responsibility for this!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Tomimi?!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Zeruertza's... going to be destroyed?
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: Ha, haha... that's a seriously unfunny joke.
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: Stitch lifts his head, and lifts his gaze to the dome.
He'd been avoiding repairing it all along. Avoiding redesigning the thing, perhaps.
He'd always assumed he'd still have time.
Only now does he realize, he's out. It's gone. He has time no longer.
Teacher, it seems my hope of surpassing you is behind me.
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: Stitch jumps aboard a small boat, and sails it for the other shore.
He has to find somewhere to calm down.
Tomimi, what are you doing here?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: We were bringing Master Edge's equipment and workers over, and came to see how it was going while were here.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Looks like we were right to do it.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: You two as well... Hold on, so, Tomimi, have you ever actually, seriously, considered what you just said?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Of course I have!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Acahualla's always been without a lord ameer, Miss Avdotya.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: It's just like you said. If all those Durins went to the surface, they'd draw the attention of the Sargon government for sure.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: So before that happens, II'll be the Sargon lord ameer to govern the Acahualla region, and I'll make all of this smooth and simple!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: No lord ameer? Even then, becoming a lord ameer isn't...
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: I hold the status of Sargon's government-posted Acahuallan Messenger... and scout.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: If I assist, then provided Acahualla comes to have a lord ameer before drawing government attention, this incident can be wholly suppressed.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: That should ease some of your concern, correct?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: But, Tomimi, you...
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: It's alright! This way, you don't need to go to any trouble, Gavial!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: I mean, yeah, but...
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: No pressure, Gavial.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Tomimi's volunteering to do it, and if she doesn't, then I can do it too.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Mm-hm!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Zumama...
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Or are you scared? You think you made a mistake?
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: I don't, I just have this weird feeling...
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Let me think up a way to describe it.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Yeah. Okay, it's like. I've got this giant boulder in front of me right now.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: And I'm thinking, I have to use up so much of my strength just to break it.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: But once I give it a shot, something tells me, wow, you can break this thing so easily.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: But it's like, why? Even though it's so big.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Gavial, how's the axe I made you? Handy?
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Yeah. Honestly, even more handy than I thought. I like it a lot.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: I stayed for days straight making it for you, and the materials are all the best I could get too.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: What? C'mon, you should've said so sooner. I'm embarrassing myself here.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: I'm telling you because I want you to understandI don't need you to thank me for making these things for you.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Because
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Because Gavial's Gavial!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: What the hell does that mean?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Something very simple
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Your fists are bigger than you think, Gavial.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Because you have me.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: And me!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: And the Rhodes Islanders, and all the people you've saved, and everyone in Acahualla too.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Because in the end, you're right, Gavial.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Ultimately, all those guys you beat into submission are willing to recognize you, because they realize that in the end, you're right.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Gavial, you believe in the right things. You've never gone wrong.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: We all believe in you, Gavial.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: So, our fists are your fists.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: And you can keep on believing in your fists.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: All you've gotta do is charge ahead, Gavial! We'll help you out!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: You guys...
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Oh, but, but
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Zumama, next time you make equipment for Gavial, I want to help too!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: I can do it myself.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: No, it's unfair only having a Zumama charm! I want to draw on my... my dreamcatcher! And the 'Gavial's Will' mark! And, and...
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Uh, no can do, Tomimi, that's too much.
attributes.name: Gavial
Tomimi
attributes.content: *wail* I'll only draw three!

attributes.name: Tomimi
attributes.content: If you don't let me draw anything, your tail will turn thick!
No putting curses on my tail!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: *whimper* Gavial, please don't bonk my head...
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Standing by Avdotya, Inam can sense that this Lupo woman to her side is having a somewhat hard time believing her eyes.
But to herself, it's a trivial, banal thing.
She lets out a small sigh.
She knows that finally, she's come to a decision too.
And on that note, I have a better proposal.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Inam?
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: I'll serve as Acahualla's lord ameer.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: I've hung around with you as a government Messenger for all these years. I have the right to stand for lord ameer.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: I just didn't want to before, that's all.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Seeing as we'd have to force Tomimi back from Rhodes Island, whereas I've been in Acahualla the whole time, I'd make a tidier fit for lord ameer, wouldn't I?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: And I imagine that better assuages your concerns, Avdotya.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Yes, it does, but I have to say, you people really boggle my mind...
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: They're... no, we're just a couple of fools living in the rainforest.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Inam, are you really sure about this?
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Well, this way, you won't need to leave Gavial, will you?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Gavial, I have this feeling we'll be fine friends, won't we?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Hahaha, of course we will!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: If you insist, then hell, go right on ahead!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Now I see. All else aside, you've definitely persuaded me. I'll make good on my commitment.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: However, Gavial, don't get carried away yet.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: An entire city's worth of people are headed for the surface. There's no precedent for something like this in all of Durin history.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: It's something the entire city has to decide on, and if the people ultimately dissent, then we're out of luck.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Which is exactly why we need you to talk 'em over.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Not a worry. I made you my promise. I'll do all I can.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Haha. Thanks.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: (Under breath) Honestly, I should be thanking you on behalf of all of Zeruertza.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Huh? What did you say?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: I said, I need to return and make some preparations.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Alright, I'll
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Are you able to draft my speech for me?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Yeah, no.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Then I suggest you do something that plays to your strengths. If I do need your help at any point, I'll let you know.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Gotcha.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Alright, Inam, we've gotta get you and Zumama back to the surface stat. Evac the elderly and children to someplace around Acahualla.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Next
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Taskforce with the working adults to enlarge the lifts, right?
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: You got it.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: No problem.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: What about me, Gavial?
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: You stay by my side, Tomimi.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Avdotya's good on assistance, so let's go see if we can help Master Edge out with anything.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Mm-hm!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Alright, 'scuse us.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Come to think of it... Zumama.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: I know this isn't too realistic, but... I'm supposing we can't return the way you and Gavial originally came?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Yep, that's not quite happening.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Then we'll need someone to show the way. The cave network's considerably complex above the network. I haven't forgotten as much for a single second.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Stitch could work, since he brought us down. Elysium too; he might even find the way better than Stitch did.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: No need. Seeing as we still have time, you come with me.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: I'll be honest; luck played an enormous part in Stitch emerging from such a complex network alive.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: And Elysium's helping Master Edge out, so let's let him be here.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: You mean to say you know the way?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: The likelihood is, nobody in modern-day Zeruertza does.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: But you know the Durin adventurers, filled with the spirit of exploration? Each time they finish a foray, they're always happy to record everything they've seen and heard in books, so they can share with their companions.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: And in the library, I once read such an adventurer's log, which finely detailed how he went through the cave network above the lift, and made it to the surface.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: And while I don't know where said adventurer is now, he was considerate enough to leave behind a map.
attributes.name: Avdotya
